DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of the adjuvant radiation therapy administered to an individual. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: iAgents given to augment or stimulate a primary therapy or alleviate adverse effects caused by the primary therapy.(NCI)_nformation related to administration of radiation therapy, treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiationneoadjuvant therapy, as treatment designed to be used as a first step toward shrinking the cancer and in evaluating response to drugs and other agents._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Agents given to augment or stimulate a primary therapy or alleviate adverse effects caused by the primary therapy.(NCI):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An agent that enhances the activity or therapeutic effect of another pharmacologic substance without having much, if any, therapeutic impact by itself.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept to value meaning. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An unstable element that releases radiation as it breaks down. Radioisotopes can be used in imaging tests or as a treatment for cancer.: Drug administration via imbedded implants used as depot formulations to limit high drug concentrations to the area surrounding the pathology or to provide sustained drug release for systemic therapy. Implant systems are used when chronic therapy is indicated and may take the form of highly viscous liquids, semi-solid formulations, rod impregnated with drug substances, or a liquid which gels in situ. Release kinetics may be controlled by varying polymer composition, different types of stimuli, such as electrical, and varying of implant structure, e.g. as coating.

Concepts.definition: A version of a chemical element that has an unstable nucleus and emits radiation during its decay to a stable form. (online dictionary)

Drug administration via imbedded implants used as depot formulations to limit high drug concentrations to the area surrounding the pathology or to provide sustained drug release for systemic therapy. Implant systems are used when chronic therapy is indicated and may take the form of highly viscous liquids, semi-solid formulations, rod impregnated with drug substances, or a liquid which gels in situ. Release kinetics may be controlled by varying polymer composition, different types of stimuli, such as electrical, and varying of implant structure, e.g. as coating.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concepts to value meaning. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) Radiation therapy that uses a machine to aim high-energy rays at the cancer.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy in which high-energy beams are delivered to the tumor from outside of the body.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added concept to value meaning. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An unstable element that releases radiation as it breaks down. Radioisotopes can be used in imaging tests or as a treatment for cancer.

Concepts.definition: A version of a chemical element that has an unstable nucleus and emits radiation during its decay to a stable form. (online dictionary)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A collection of things that have been assembled together to form a new whole.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A collection of things that have been assembled together to form a new whole.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ray-dee-AY-shun) A procedure in which radioactive material sealed in needles, seeds, wires, or catheters is placed directly into or near a tumor. Also called brachytherapy, internal radiation, or interstitial radiation.

Concepts.definition: A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.

Affecting an entire system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The treatment plan for a disease or disorder that has been chosen as the best one for a patient after all other choices have been considered.

Concepts.definition: The treatment plan for a disease or disorder that has been chosen as the best one for a patient after all other choices have been considered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy that is administered subsequent to the main treatment plan to minimize or prevent disease recurrence.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy that is administered subsequent to the main treatment plan to minimize or prevent disease recurrence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.

Concepts.definition: Any radiation treatment done with the intent to relieve symptoms and reduce the suffering caused by the cancer, and not with the intent of curing the cancer.
